title: Riot took down my original post. Perma Ban
body:
I've just received a Perma ban. I can't post the chat logs and I don't feel like going over it again. So now that I'm banned I can't report the guy. Riot took down my post and told me the correct way to go about it is to report him. But I can't. You banned me before I could even report him. You banned me because of an automated system that responds to high volume reports.


[](http://i.imgur.com/CJ65VDi.jpg)

[](http://i.imgur.com/iOPLn5c.jpg)

replies.body:
This is your 4th penalty within 4 months. You were not banned for a high volume of reports, you were banned because of your behavior. Reports flag games for review.

The first 3 times you were punished, you were told your behavior was not acceptable. You were given 13 games of your chat logs for these first 3 penalties, illustrating the types of behavior that are not tolerated.

You chose to ignore the warning that the next penalty of any severity would result in a permanent ban of your account.

You have a tendency to chat about things that aren't happening in an attempt to 'frame' other players who you want penalized. You threaten people with getting them punished pretty consistently.

> I couldn't report him. I wasn't even in the post game lobby for 30 seconds before I was disconnected and received the ban message. 

It was more like 5 minutes after the game in your case. You had plenty of time to report a player. You chose to use the time arguing in post-game chat.
*shut down*
"Hello, 911? Yeah, I just witnessed a fucking murder."
{{summoner:11}}
SWEET JESUS, TANTRAM. HE HAS A FAMILY!

https://cdn.meme.am/instances/57315757.jpg

For OP: http://www.wikihow.com/Use-Aloe-Vera-to-Treat-Burns

The Instant Feedback System doesn't issue punishment based on you being reported a lot; reports merely flag your matches for review, and when you do receive too many they are then reviewed for accuracy. If the behavior found in them is determined to be consistently creating a negative environment for the other players or you are being extremely toxic, you will be punished based on that.

Frequency and severity of your behavior and your record of prior punishments is what is relevant to why you were issued a permaban. If you wish to discuss the punishment with the community you should post your reform card/chat logs. If you only wish to contest the ban with Riot or get more information from them, you'll have to submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

Reporting players in the post-game lobby should be your go-to option for reporting so that the system can handle it, but if you were unable to and the offense is *so* severe that you believe a manual review is that necessary you can submit a ticket for it.

If you can get away with that type of behavior then I'll just have to adapt. I wasn't telling him that he should've been aborted or anything like that.

I mean, the only thing that you'll prove is that Riot was right to ban you if this is your response.

If the person you would have reported was close enough to get banned on the next report, that situation wouldn't have changed over the next few games for him. And they would have likely been punished if someone else had reported them post-game as well.
I'll live within the confines of the rules. Kind of like the NE Patriots.
So you'll, "_Enjoy Yourself, but not at Anyone Else's Expense_"?

and it doesn't matter at all what anyone else said. What matters is what you said.

That has nothing to do with me and my bank or paypal.

But it has everything to do with getting the money from Riot.

In the case of fraud, the cardholder has every right to file a chargeback. However, this is the only situation where the consumer should call the bank first. In any other circumstance, the cardholder needs to deal directly with the merchant. Filing a chargeback instead of seeking a traditional refund when unsatisfied with a purchase is cyber shoplifting.

There was no fraud here.

I told you. The [Instant Feedback System](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq-updated-for-instant-feedback) reviews your reported matches and issues punishment within 15 minutes. This isn't 1985, the system isn't as dumb and slow as you think. When Riot manually reviewed every report going through the system initially it was shown to have a false positive rate of less than 1:6000.

The vast majority of the time Riot agrees with the system's judgment. If you wish for them to manually review your case, use a ticket. Again, concerning the one game you posted the reports were definitely valid due to your negative behavior (again again, that is the only thing you gave us so is the only thing I am addressing).

If you'd like me to grab some of the [Arbiters](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/opVBd7rZ-introducing-the-arbiters) who are knowledgeable on Player Behavior systems and officially supported by Riot, I can put some bait out for them to speak with you.

https://i.gyazo.com/4f57fc083dc066c4fbe65801b034c3e3.png

> What I'm getting at is that I did not break the rules. 

I can only give you insight on the one chat log you provided. In this chat you were insulting someone by calling them a scrub and low elo, and you were threatening them with reports and a ban. While this alone isn't something that would get you permabanned, you had just come off of a 14 day ban for this kind of behavior which means you were on thin ice and this behavior is reportable.[ The punishment after a 14 day account ban is a permaban.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/yFLxpAcV-qa-about-player-behavior-systems-chat-log-reviews-and-feedback)

> Since the system is automated there surely has to be room for a flaw. With that being said you can get reported by say 4-5 people and trigger it. All you have to do is all chat someone is being toxic and flaming you even though they aren't and trigger it.

I did mention there was a tiny chance of false positives, but it is very tiny. This one example of the logs you are showing was not a false positive for the reasons I mentioned above. A review of your reported matches is triggered by report volume, but they are validated by the system and punishment is only given if it finds punishable behavior; more reports won't make the system change whether they were valid or not.

It's also important to note here that premade reports do not stack and cannot trigger a review more than a single solo report.

> Threatening to Perma ban support singed

Please read this thread and the linked comment regarding the real reason he was punished (hint: it wasn't for playing Support Singed or not buying Sightstone); http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/79aGu3wR-support-singed-isnt-banable-but-thats-not-the-point?comment=006b

If you submitted a ticket to request a chargeback you probably don't know what a chargeback is. Riot won't refund you, an intentional chargeback in this case is when you scam Riot by having your bank or 3rd party payment company return the payment. Doing it is a scam and I do not recommend it.

cos your punishment history (including your chat restrictions and 14-day ban) places you to a point that you were deemed by the system to be "consistently toxic".

Since you didn't show reform after your 14-day ban, they just had to remove you from the game. 

The instant feedback system can detect simple intentional feeding behavior, the more complexed ones require human review.

Reports don't matter, *valid* reports matter.

The Automatic system read your chat, said "yup, this matches what the humans have deemed unacceptable," looked up what step to follow next, which in your case was a Permaban. It followed the exact same steps when you were chat restricted and given a two week ban. It's as fair as your chat restrictions or 2 week ban were, because it didn't change the standard it held you to.

You could be reported in thousands of games; if they weren't valid, you wouldn't be punished.

> [2. ACCOUNT TERMINATION](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse#account-termination)

>2.1. How can my account be suspended or terminated? (If you break the rules, Demacian Justice will be visited upon your account!)

>Three different people/entities can suspend or terminate your account:

>2.1.1. You. You may terminate or suspend your account at any time by contacting us at support@riotgames.com.

>2.1.2. Us.We may terminate or suspend your account if we determine, in our sole discretion, that:

>(a) you have violated any part of this Agreement;

>(b) we have stopped offering the Riot Services in your region; or

>(c) doing so would be in the best interests of our community, the Riot Services, or the rights of a third party.

>We may make such determinations, among other ways, by using automated systems and machine learning tools.

>2.1.3. The Tribunal®. The Tribunal® system allows our community of users to police the compliance of other users with the “[Summoner’s Code](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/),” which outlines the principles of ideal game play behavior, as well as with our other policies. Community members, including you, may submit descriptions of activity and actions of certain users within the Game, and collectively determine if that particular user was in compliance with our policies. If The Tribunal determines, in its sole discretion, that you have violated one of our policies, we may suspend or terminate your account on behalf of the community.

>2.2. What happens if my account is terminated? (No LoL for you.)

>If your account is terminated, you’ll no longer have access to it, including any of the associated data or content (e.g., champions, skins, Riot Points, etc.). You’ll not be entitled to any refunds and we’ll have no liability to you. We also reserve the right to terminate any other accounts you may have created (also without any refunds or liability to you).

>You understand and agree that using the Riot Services comes with the risk that your account may be terminated or suspended and that, whenever you use the Riot Services, you’ll bear this risk in mind and always conduct yourself appropriately.
Also, I was banned within 30 seconds of coming out of the game so you're telling me there is no automated system?

I don't think anybody said it wasn't automated. It *is* automated, it's call the [Instant Feedback System](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq-updated-for-instant-feedback) and it reviews a case and issues punishment within 15 minutes of the triggering report. What dynikus meant from his comment is that the system isn't based on report volume, not that there is no automated system.

If your reaction to being banned is to act even worse, you haven't learned anything and you'll just get permabans even faster. This other person is treated just the same as you are; if he acts this way frequently and is reported for it he'll have *his* review and punishment coming.
Seems like more than enough time to flag and review. I'm not asking to be unbanned. I'm just going to conduct myself like that blitzcrank in the future. It's acceptable behavior I guess.
